title: Heavy Competition
description: Dwight chooses loyalty to Dunder Mifflin over loyalty to Michael, which leads to a bitter battle between Michael and Dwight over Dwight's accounts. Back at Dunder Mifflin, Jim pretends to confide in Andy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hup! [throws cheese puff to Ryan who catches it in his mouth]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Things are a little slow here. And there's only so much cold-calling you can do in a day. Turns out there's no limit to the number of cheese puffs you can throw at someone's face.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hup! [throws cheese puff to Pam who catches it in her mouth]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We're getting pretty good at it.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam and Ryan throw cheese puffs to Michael,  Ryan and Michael throw cheese puffs at each other, Michael throws a cheese puff over his shoulder to Ryan, all three throw cheese puffs to one another, give high-fives]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Pam yawns, two cheese puffs thrown at her, one sticks in her hair]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy put down a bunch of deposits on stuff for his wedding with Angela, but then she was sleeping with Dwight for... several years. Wait, no, that can't be right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The timeline's messy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Anyway, now we are going bargain hunting in the haunted graveyard of their love.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is my solo. [stereo plays Andy imitating bass guitar, a cappella starts singing 'You Can Call Me Al']

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm confused. Am I walking down the aisle to 'You Can Call Me Al?'

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Trust me. You will not be walking. You will be boogie-ing.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I am extremely interested. So, how much will all of this cost?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, 12 guys, airfare, three nights in a hotel, food per diem, table up front for merch... $9,000.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know. It seems like a lot for an a cappella group from a college we never went to.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Did you even hear the music I just played for you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What's wrong with you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: These sleeves are cutting off my circulation. Not enough blood getting to my hands.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I think you look nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Doesn't Charles know he's compromising my attack readiness? It's not a dress code. It's a death sentence.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Looking good.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: 'Kay, thank you. It's a straight jacket! [knocks things off shelf with arms] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When Michael was in charge, this place was like the Roman Empire. And the Wild West. And war-torn Poland. And Poland. There was just a lot going on, so what you wore to work was the least of anybody's worries. And in that chaos, I soared.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey. Ed's Tires is thinking of making a change.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [gestures to 'Bed & Breakfast' magazine] Is this good?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They have some great kitchen ideas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Okay. Ed's Tires, huh?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's small, I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I really appreciate it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thanks, Michael. [Michael palms Dwight cash in their handshake] Wait, what is this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's for your trouble.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wh-  I don't need $6 to help a friend.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, listen, as a friend, I want you to have this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, you know I can't take this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But don't forget you owe me $10.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was four years ago. Why don't you let it go?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What was up with Pam being all pushy and negative in there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think she just didn't want a crucifix cake.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It scares me to see you going down a road that I went down.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Am I going down a road?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: When I see her bossing you around like that, it just makes me wonder if this thing really has the legs to go the distance.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's so scary how right the things you're saying are. And you're coming at it with almost no knowledge, so of course I trust your opinion on this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I know a few things about love.  Horrible, terrible, awful, awful things.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I was going to use today to purge my inbox, but now something much more pressing has come up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ed's Tires. Why don't you tell them that we have fewer clients, so we can spend more time with each of them. Also, try to discuss it over Indian food, and try to mention how you distrust women.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm not gonna do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is smart. That would not seem genuine. Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I can get there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, you take the lead on this one. Also, do not forget that he has just gone through a messy divorce.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, awesome.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bring it in. Morning cheer. [clears throat]

quotes.speaker: {michael}, {pam} & {ryan}
quotes.text: U-G-L-Y, you ain't got no alibi! You ugly, huh huh, you ugly! You mama says you ugly! Hey! Go Michael Scott Paper Company!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm here. I'm a part of this now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You needed to speak to me?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Dwight, take a seat.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I prefer to stand. Less blood clots.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Nah, that's weird. You're gonna sit. [Dwight sits] Great. You know, Dwight, it has been quite a transition for all of us. Are you happy with the way things have been runnin' lately?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you mean compared to the ways things ran with other bosses? Comparisons are hard.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: I've just been impressed with your performance and I wanted to make sure good work doesn't go unnoticed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Your concern is noted.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Yeah, I like your work ethic. You're so... focused.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Like a wolf. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: And I wanna start givin' you more responsibility. What do you say you and I go out for a drink this week?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Definitely.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sighs] It's firm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] I need you to get me the prices that you're charging Ed's tires so I can undercut Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't know that I can do that now. You know, uh, something's come up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh n- Is it Mose? Did you put the cover on that well?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, Mose is fine. I roped it off. It's not about Mose. Listen, things are changing here, Michael, they're changing fast.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not following you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Imagine... Someone has a personal hero they really wanna help. But then there's this new guy. Very cool, very Will Smith-esque, who would not like it if he helped his hero.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Personal hero, cool new guy. Okay, I think I'm getting your drift.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good, do you see what I'm saying?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Crystal clear. So is this for a movie that you're writing?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Can I use it? [Pam holds up note saying "He's talking about you!"]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Michael dismisses note, Ryan and Pam point to notepad] Dwight, are you talking about us?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is possible that I could be talking about us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Someone could say that it is like the situation that we are in now?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It is the situation that we are in now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So I would say that the old boss has always been good to Dwight, and he was there first, so he has dibs. You respect dibs, don't you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm not a barbarian.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Will you meet me in 20 minutes at the spot?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is the cool new guy Charles?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I've said too much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is it Stanley?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, Andy. You know I've been thinkin about what you said-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: 'Noishe.'

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: -I just don't know if I can do it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's interesting, because I hear what you're saying is that you want to do it, which means you can do it. Believe me, I broke up with Angela, and I'm like, the happiest guy ever. I mean, I'm so happy. I'm so happy. Like, total freedom, you know?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's just that Pam gets me through the day, you know? I really rely on her. I'm pretty emotionally needy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And you know what? I am here for you. Let me be your traveling pants. [imitates punching on Jim's fist] Ah, what'd you do that for?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [both laugh] You know that I was doin' this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [fist pound each other] Totally.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello, Dwight. What's with the shirt? Are you alright?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm sorry, Michael

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: [Charles comes from around corner] Hi, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God! Run! Run! It's a setup. Setup!

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: No, Mich-Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, run!

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Michael, no, let's be cool, ok?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You be cool.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just-what's going on?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: We need to talk about our two companies, and how we should behave. Dwight tells me you've been pestering him for company info.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-do... Dwight would not-

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: He did.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I did, Michael.  I was upset about the shirt sleeves at first, but now I'm okay with it.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Michael, I want you to stop pestering my salesmen, and I want you to leave Dunder Mifflin alone. Do you understand?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I. Understand. Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Michael storms into office] Wow.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, are you alright?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was a setup. Dwight told Charles. He told him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Tell us what you're talking about.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's like, a girl says she'll make out with you, but then her boyfriend is waiting around the corner with a pee-filled balloon.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We can't help you if you don't just tell us what happened.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I got hit in the face with a pee-filled water balloon, Pam, ok? I don't know how they did it. They filled the balloon with pee. A funnel? I don't know. Is that clear enough for you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Jim slams lunchbag on table] I just totally blew a sales call.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Bro, I do that all the time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, well, with you it's different, okay? Cause I just- I just suck. I just- I suck!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Tuna, be nice to my friend Jim, ok?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why? When I look in the mirror, I don't like the face that looks back.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, so what?  Your body's a ten.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Forget it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I said forget it. [drop kicks lunch across room, stomps on it]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on phone] Dwight Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello, traitor.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think you have the wrong number, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to listen to me, friend, and I want you to listen to me good. I am going to come at you, and I am going to come at you hard. I am going to steal all of your clients, and then I am going to kill them in front of you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm just getting hardcore with him.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Finally.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, and hear me, Dwight, when I say I brought you into this world, and I can take you out. [hangs up] Bill Cosby.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [on phone] Mr. Schofield, please?

quotes.speaker: Secretary
quotes.text: He's in a meeting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dammit! [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] Is Mr. Schofield there?

quotes.speaker: Automated Phone Voice
quotes.text: If you'd like to reach an outside line, please dial nine first. [Michael sighs, hangs up phone]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: So, you think Michael's going after the whale, huh?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have a long term relationship with Harper Collins publishers and Mr. Schofield. I'm not worried.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You sound worried.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And you have bad skin. Oh, look everyone, we're all making observations! [gibberish sounds]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on phone] Well, if you could do me a big favor and tell Mr. Schofield that Michael Scott has tickets to the Wilkes-Barre Penguins game this weekend, and if he would like to join me... Hello, Daniel. How are you? Uh-huh. I sure do. Yes. [referencing rolodex card] Wanted to ask, did Kathy ever make JV?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Look at that old dude and his rolodex go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I spent a month putting that rolodex on his Blackberry, which he now uses as a nightlight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow. High score?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And no, I cannot lower my current prices. [phone rings] Hold on. Hello? Mr. Schofield, thank you so much for taking the time to talk. I wanted to discuss your contract with us- oh, you're considering him. I thought Michael Scott left the paper business after his nervous breakdown.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael has been talking to my biggest client. Master and apprentice pitted against one another for the fate of the greater Scranton area paper market.  So it's not exactly like 'Highlander,' but still...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello, Dwight, I've been expecting your call. What do you want?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I would like to arrange a truce.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So you heard Schofield is considering a switch, and you want mercy?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Meet me in our spot in four minutes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No. You think I am going to fall for that? There's no-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Meet- Ok, go to the spot and then walk 100 feet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In which direction?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Toward the sun.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: At what time?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Noon.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You have two seconds. [Dwight starts running]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [looking at his watch] Michael. [Madge walks by] Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I hope you're not recording this conversation. [Dwight drops his pants and lifts up his shirt] Good. I cannot believe that you sided with Charles.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You were making me do things that were not all right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So you just rat me out? You could have said no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And not come through for you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you want a truce, I will give you a truce.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I want a truce.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me take you and your whole company out for lunch at Alfredo's.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cooper's.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I had fish yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Damn it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Michael, Ryan and Pam sitting at restaurant, phone rings] Oh. Dwight-elicious. Where you at?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, hi, Michael. I'm so sorry I'm late. I got stuck in traffic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Really? That's weird. We didn't see any.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I hit a bear.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He's technically fine. I imagine the true horror will be when he wakes up in a zoo. [throws a fish into the vent at Michael's office] Hey, listen, will you do me a favor and order the meatball parm for me, with extra cheese?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, sure.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, I will see you very soon, alright? [takes all the items off Michael's desk and puts them into briefcase, including rolodex]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, see you in a bit. Dwight hit a bear. He'll be here in a sec.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Pam, Ryan and Michael enter office] Sounds neat.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: We can spend a couple days there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God, I think we've been robbed!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Michael answers phone] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did you enjoy your lunch?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, not now, we've been robbed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, Michael, you were sabotaged.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Dwight, we were robbed. How would you even know? You're still stuck in traffic. [Pam holds up sign saying "Dwight did it!!"] You?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What about our truce?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I broke it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On purpose?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You think this is some kind of game? No, this is a war, and I will not stop, I will not rest. You have no idea what kind of enemy you've created. You have unleashed the wolf!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Be that as it may, I have your meatball parm sandwich here, and I am going to eat it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And I knew that you would do that. The meatball parm is their worst sandwich!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. [bites into sandwich, looks disgusted] Bastard!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hi there. Dwight Schrute here. I was just calling to see if Michael Scott Paper was meeting all of your paper needs, and how is [reading off rolodex card] Brenda, age four, ponytail, and Simon, age 7? Oh, you don't say.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [holding up rolodex card] Schrute comma Dwight. And on the back he wrote, "great salesman, better friend." [turns card over] "Tall" and "beets."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And say hello to Cheri, who is your black wife. [hangs up and answers cell phone] I see you're begging for mercy, huh?  Well, you will find none here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, do you mind if we talk?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sure. That'd be fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If you keep coming after us, the Michael Scott Paper Company cannot succeed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is war and that is what happens.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, one more thing. I'm going to have you listen while I steal your biggest client.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, no. No. No. No. No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, uh oh, I'm turning you down right now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael! Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can hear me, but I can't hear you.

quotes.speaker: Secretary
quotes.text: Mr. Schofield's ready to see you now, Mr. Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, great. Mr. Schofield's ready to see me. Thank you so much.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't let him in! He's a traitor! Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Walking in the door...

quotes.speaker: Mr. Schofield
quotes.text: Michael, good to see you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mr. Schofield, good to see you. And I'm closing the door. [Dwight runs out of the office]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [on speakerphone in Dwight's car] Now, when Dwight tells you that he will keep prices steady for a year, I think he is speaking out of turn.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Schofield
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. He does not have the authority to say that. I, on the other hand, am the president, the owner, and the founder. It is like you are buying software from Bill Gates.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are you saying you invented paper?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [hugging a crying Jim] Okay, okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, God.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, Tuna.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Hey, guys.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Excuse me, can I have your attention, everyone? Here's the deal, everybody, Jim Halpert is very upset and disturbed. I don't know if it was something you did, something you said, a look you gave him, maybe it was nothing at all, but here's the deal, ok? It stops now.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I guess I could be nicer.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Andy, I think Jim is messing with you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, really?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Mm-hmm. [looks over to Jim smiling through windows to the kitchen]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, okay, what the heck is happennin' here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Two things I need you to understand. One, Pam and I are very happy together.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, that's not what was-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And two, that stuff that happened with you and Angela is a bummer, and I know you don't think you're ever gonna find someone else, but you will. I promise you, you will.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh man, he got me so good. I learned something about myself today. Yeah. I wish this was a sofa, cause I feel like I could sit here and talk for hours.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is that thing that Dwight always says? Paper is the soil in which the seeds of business grow?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's not the soil! It's the manure! Paper is the manure! On-time delivery is the soil! Aah! [runs into office]

quotes.speaker: Secretary
quotes.text: Uh, hello, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Spin move.

quotes.speaker: Secretary
quotes.text: Oh-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ha ha! April 13th, 2002.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Schofield
quotes.text: Dwight, I'm in a meeting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's very rude.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I barge because I care. April 13th, 2002, that is the date when you tried to switch paper providers for an obscure sociology textbook, but were hung out to dry when the price of glossy stock increased.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Schofield
quotes.text: Maybe we should schedule a meeting on our-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: La la la! Continuing.  Notice my persistence and recall. Continuing! You called Dunder Mifflin, and your order was filled within an hour!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm going to pull a date out of the air right now. April 13th, 2002. That is the last day that you evaluated your paper needs. Is it not? We all know that the economy is bad, and bloated companies like Dunder Mifflin...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are going to fall by the wayside. Two of their branches have closed within the last year. The Michael Scott Paper Company, however, has opened a new branch this very month.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What he's not telling you is that he will abandon you.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Schofield
quotes.text: Why don't you guys just e-mail me your best offers and we can finish it up that way?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That sounds like a fantastic idea. I will see you this weekend for the Penguins. Box seats as usual.

quotes.speaker: Mr. Schofield
quotes.text: Uh, ok, sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, good, good. I will see you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you, Mr. Schofield, for your time. Much appreciated. Oh, and tell me, um, how's your gay son?

quotes.speaker: Mr. Schofield
quotes.text: Excuse me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I color code all my info. I wrote "gay son" in green. Green means go, so I know to go ahead and shut up about it. Orange means "Orange you glad you didn't bring it up?" Most colors mean "Don't say it."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How is Tom, the homosexual sophomore?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I wanted to start a company, not a war. Because in a war, you always fight those you are closest to. And the great tragedy of the civil war is that brother fought against brother. For what? What purpose did that serve? Apart from abolishing slavery? In that case, war was the right choice. This doesn't feel as important though. That's just how the world works, I guess.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [muffled speech, Ryan, Michael, and Pam all have mouths stuffed with cheese puffs, Michael answers the phone and talks with mouth full]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He gives me leads and I take the leads from him and in exchange it makes him feel good. And if a friend can't make you feel good, then I don't want any friends. Except Dwight, because he is our only source of fertile leads.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight just got Howard Family Dry Cleaners.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Uncle Dave?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He's undercutting us big time. He's actually taking a loss and paying the difference out of pocket.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That's my family. When you mess with my family, I can't be responsible for my actions.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: When are you ever responsible for your actions?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Get off my ass, you hag.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey. Something about that seems inappropriate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Betrayal ain't just a river in Egypt.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who is that knocking on my taste buds? Why, it's Mr. Lemon. Hmmm, nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's good. But won't it feel weird cutting into a cross?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Don't think of it as a cross in the Judeo-Christian sense, think of it more as a symbol of your lives crossing in marriage.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: When I think of it like that, I do not think of the other connotations.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think so, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sorry. Her day.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, bud.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are they looking at me?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Everyone. Everyone just keeps looking at me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you sure?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Will you just talk to them, please? Pam just knew!
